item.title: Baked Sea Bass with Peppers
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2, oven at 200°C, takes around 50 minutes overall. Goes well with green beans. From Judith’s green recipe book. 2 halves sea bass1 red pepper, cut into chunks1 yellow pepper, ditto1 small red onion, cut into wedges2 tomatoes, quartered25g pine nutes15g parsley, choppedOlive oilSalt Put peppers, tomatoes, onion, and salt on a baking tray. item.dc:creator: Ian Stark

item.title: Toucan Surprise
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Toucan Surprise (Serves 4, oven at 200°C) 1 can tuna (or more, suggests Judith) 1 can condensed mushroom soup Sweetcorn — tinned or frozen (if frozen, cook along with pasta) 400g pasta Grated cheese for topping Put pasta on to boil, and heat oven. item.title: Vegetable Lasagne
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.category: Does not kill in five minutes
item.description: Serves 4–6, oven at 180°C. Ragu 2×400g tins chopped tomatoes2 onions, chopped1 carrot, chopped1 stick celery, chopped1 tsp sugar10 tbsp olive oil2 tsp dried oregano1–2 garlic cloves, crushed1 green and 1 red pepper, de-seeded and chopped225g courgettes, thinly sliced225g mushrooms, sliced White Sauce 750ml milk50g margarine50g flourground nutmeg Lasagne 250g lasagneparmesan cheese This needs big […]

item.title: Beans on Toast
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Not really beans on toast at all, but that’s the name that brings it to mind. It’s a chickpea and tomato stew really. Ian! Next time, try adding a frozen spinach block to the bean mix. Generous quantities for 4 2 onions, garlic, finely chopped2 potatoes, boiled and cubed2 tsp cumin (optionally the same of […]

item.title: Chickpea Pasticcio
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (Oven at 180°) Cross-breed from chickpea moussaka and Julie’s recipe for pasticcio. Onion and garlicTin tomatoesTin chickpeasTomato purée2 tsp cinnamon1/2 glass red wine (or not)Grated cheese1 pt milk>1 oz flour>1 oz soft margarine2 eggs 500g pasta: ideally long thick tubes (ziti?), but rigatone, penne or similar will do. item.title: Lasagne

item.description: Lasagne (Serves 4–5, oven at 180°C) Ragu 1 onion garlic possibly some chopped celery, carrot 1lb mince basil 14oz tin tomatoes tomato purée ½ glass red wine White Sauce (consider making more?) 1½pt milk, or milk & cream 2oz margarine 2oz flour ground nutmeg Lasagne 8oz lasagne parmesan Chop onions and garlic, fry in oil. item.title: Bean Mush
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (Quantities for 3–4) 1 onion1 tbsp olive oilTin red kidney beansTin black-eyed beans (or cannellini, or borlotti)(We don’t always have black-eyed beans. So be prepared to use one of the others.)Tin tomatoesTomato purée4oz mushrooms1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce8oz mozarella1 tbsp chopped parsley Fry onion in oil.
